Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition br-core-careplan

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
CarePlan CarePlan
identifier 0..*IdentifierIdentificadores externos para este recurso
instantiatesCanonical 0..*canonical(PlanDefinition | Questionnaire | Measure | ActivityDefinition | OperationDefinition)Instancia o protocolo ou definição FHIR
instantiatesUri 0..*uriInstancia protocolo externo ou definição
basedOn 0..*Reference(BRCoreCarePlan)Cumpre o plano de cuidado
replaces 0..*Reference(BRCoreCarePlan)Plano de cuidado substituído por este plano de cuidado
partOf 0..*Reference(BRCoreCarePlan)Parte do plano de cuidado referenciado
status 1..1codeO status desse plano de cuidado
intent 1..1codePropósito do plano de cuidado definido
category 0..*CodeableConceptTipo de plano de cuidado
title 0..1stringNome casual para o plano de cuidado
description 1..1stringResumo da natureza do plano de cuidado
subject 1..1Reference(BRCorePatient)Paciente cujo o plano de cuidado referencia
encounter 0..1Reference(br-core-encounter)Atendimento no qual o plano de cuidado foi definido
period 0..1PeriodO período de tempo que o plano de cuidado abrange
created 0..1dateTimeData em que o registro foi gravado pela primeira vez
author 0..1Reference(BRCorePractitioner | BRCorePractitionerRole | BRCoreOrganization | BRCorePatient | BRCoreRelatedPerson | Device | CareTeam)Quem é o responsável pela definição do plano de cuidado
contributor 0..*Reference(BRCorePractitioner | BRCorePractitionerRole | BRCoreOrganization | BRCorePatient | BRCoreRelatedPerson | Device | CareTeam)Quem forneceu o conteúdo do plano de cuidados
careTeam 0..*Reference(CareTeam)Quem está envolvido no plano de cuidado
addresses 0..1Reference(BRCoreCondition)Problemas de saúde que este plano aborda
supportingInfo 0..*Reference(Resource)Informações consideradas como parte do plano de cuidado
goal 0..*Reference(Goal)Resultado desejado do plano de cuidado
activity 1..1BackboneElementAção a ocorrer como parte do plano de cuidado
outcomeCodeableConcept 0..*CodeableConceptResultados da atividade
outcomeReference 0..*Reference(Resource)Appointment, Encounter, Procedure, etc.
progress 0..*AnnotationComentários sobre o status/progresso da atividade
reference 0..1Reference(Appointment | CommunicationRequest | DeviceRequest | MedicationRequest | NutritionOrder | Task | ServiceRequest | VisionPrescription | RequestGroup)Detalhes da atividade definidos em recurso específico
detail 1..1BackboneElementDefinição da atividade em conformidade
kind 0..1codeTipos de recursos definidos como parte do FHIR que podem ser representados como definições em conformidade de uma atividade do plano de cuidados
instantiatesCanonical 0..*canonical(PlanDefinition | ActivityDefinition | Questionnaire | Measure | OperationDefinition)Instancia o protocolo ou definição FHIR
instantiatesUri 0..*uriInstancia protocolo externo ou definição
code 0..1CodeableConceptTipo de atividade detalhada
Binding: Subgrupos da Tabela SUS (required)
reasonCode 0..*CodeableConceptPor que a atividade deve ser feita ou por que a atividade foi proibida
reasonReference 0..*Reference(Condition | Observation | DiagnosticReport | DocumentReference)Por que a atividade é necessária
goal 0..*Reference(Goal)Objetivos com os quais esta atividade se relaciona
status 1..1codeCódigos que refletem o estado atual de uma atividade do plano de cuidados dentro de seu ciclo de vida geral.
statusReason 0..1CodeableConceptMotivo do status atual
doNotPerform 0..1booleanSe for verdade, a atividade está proibindo a ação
scheduled[x] 1..1Timing, Period, stringQuando a atividade deve ocorrer
location 0..1Reference(Location)Onde a atividade deve ocorrer
performer 0..*Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Organization | RelatedPerson | Patient | CareTeam | HealthcareService | Device)Quem será responsável pela atividade
product[x] 0..1CodeableConcept, Reference(Medication | Substance)O que deve ser administrado/fornecido
dailyAmount 0..1SimpleQuantityComo consumir/dia?
quantity 0..1SimpleQuantityQuanto administrar/fornecer/consumir
description 1..1stringInformações extras descrevendo a atividade a ser realizada
note 0..*AnnotationComentários sobre o plano de cuidados

Documentation for this format

name: BRCoreCarePlan
description: Este perfil restringe o recurso [CarePlan](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/careplan.html) que descreve a intenção de como um ou mais profissionais pretendem prestar cuidados a um determinado paciente, grupo ou comunidade por um período de tempo, possivelmente limitado ao cuidado de uma condição específica ou conjunto de condições.

element.short: Healthcare plan for patient or group
element.definition: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Identificadores externos para este recurso
element.definition: Identificadores externos para este recurso
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
element.requirements: Allows identification of the care plan as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Instancia o protocolo ou definição FHIR
element.definition: Instancia o protocolo ou definição FHIR

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Instancia protocolo externo ou definição
element.definition: Instancia protocolo externo ou definição
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Cumpre o plano de cuidado
element.definition: Cumpre o plano de cuidado
element.requirements: Allows tracing of the care plan and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Plano de cuidado substituído por este plano de cuidado
element.definition: Plano de cuidado substituído por este plano de cuidado
element.comment: The replacement could be because the initial care plan was immediately rejected (due to an issue) or because the previous care plan was completed, but the need for the action described by the care plan remains ongoing.
element.requirements: Allows tracing the continuation of a therapy or administrative process instantiated through multiple care plans.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Parte do plano de cuidado referenciado
element.definition: Parte do plano de cuidado referenciado
element.comment: Each care plan is an independent request, such that having a care plan be part of another care plan can cause issues with cascading statuses.  As such, this element is still being discussed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: O status desse plano de cuidado
element.definition: draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.comment:
The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses.  The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the care plan.

This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the plan as not currently valid.
element.requirements: Allows clinicians to determine whether the plan is actionable or not.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

mapping.map: .statusCode planned = new active = active completed = completed

element.short: Propósito do plano de cuidado definido
element.definition: proposal | plan | order | option
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.
element.requirements: Proposals/recommendations, plans and orders all use the same structure and can exist in the same fulfillment chain.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element changes the interpretation of all descriptive attributes. For example "the time the request is recommended to occur" vs. "the time the request is authorized to occur" or "who is recommended to perform the request" vs. "who is authorized to perform the request"

binding.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a care plan.

element.short: Tipo de plano de cuidado
element.definition: Tipo de plano de cuidado
element.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one plan may serve multiple purposes.  In some cases, this may be redundant with references to CarePlan.concern.
element.requirements: Used for filtering what plan(s) are retrieved and displayed to different types of users.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

element.short: Nome casual para o plano de cuidado
element.definition: Nome casual para o plano de cuidado

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Resumo da natureza do plano de cuidado
element.definition: Resumo da natureza do plano de cuidado
element.requirements: Provides more detail than conveyed by category.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Paciente cujo o plano de cuidado referencia
element.definition: Paciente cujo o plano de cuidado referencia

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Atendimento no qual o plano de cuidado foi definido
element.definition: Atendimento no qual o plano de cuidado foi definido
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. CarePlan activities conducted as a result of the care plan may well occur as part of other encounters.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: O período de tempo que o plano de cuidado abrange
element.definition: O período de tempo que o plano de cuidado abrange
element.comment: Any activities scheduled as part of the plan should be constrained to the specified period regardless of whether the activities are planned within a single encounter/episode or across multiple encounters/episodes (e.g. the longitudinal management of a chronic condition).
element.requirements: Allows tracking what plan(s) are in effect at a particular time.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Data em que o registro foi gravado pela primeira vez
element.definition: Data em que o registro foi gravado pela primeira vez

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quem é o responsável pela definição do plano de cuidado
element.definition: Quem é o responsável pela definição do plano de cuidado
element.comment: The author may also be a contributor.  For example, an organization can be an author, but not listed as a contributor.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quem forneceu o conteúdo do plano de cuidados
element.definition: Quem forneceu o conteúdo do plano de cuidados
element.comment: Collaborative care plans may have multiple contributors.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quem está envolvido no plano de cuidado
element.definition: Quem está envolvido no plano de cuidado
element.requirements: Allows representation of care teams, helps scope care plan.  In some cases may be a determiner of access permissions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Request.performer {similar but does not entail CareTeam}

element.short: Problemas de saúde que este plano aborda
element.definition: Problemas de saúde que este plano aborda
element.comment: When the diagnosis is related to an allergy or intolerance, the Condition and AllergyIntolerance resources can both be used. However, to be actionable for decision support, using Condition alone is not sufficient as the allergy or intolerance condition needs to be represented as an AllergyIntolerance.
element.requirements: Links plan to the conditions it manages.  The element can identify risks addressed by the plan as well as active conditions.  (The Condition resource can include things like "at risk for hypertension" or "fall risk".)  Also scopes plans - multiple plans may exist addressing different concerns.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Informações consideradas como parte do plano de cuidado
element.definition: Informações consideradas como parte do plano de cuidado
element.comment: Use "concern" to identify specific conditions addressed by the care plan.
element.requirements: Identifies barriers and other considerations associated with the care plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Resultado desejado do plano de cuidado
element.definition: Resultado desejado do plano de cuidado
element.comment: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.
element.requirements: Provides context for plan.  Allows plan effectiveness to be evaluated by clinicians.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Ação a ocorrer como parte do plano de cuidado
element.definition: Ação a ocorrer como parte do plano de cuidado
element.requirements: Allows systems to prompt for performance of planned activities, and validate plans against best practice.

constraint.human: Provide a reference or detail, not both
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map:
{no mapping
NOTE: This is a list of contained Request-Event tuples!}

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Resultados da atividade
element.definition: Resultados da atividade
element.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the activity status (e.g. completed or in progress).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies the results of the activity.

element.short: Appointment, Encounter, Procedure, etc.
element.definition: Appointment, Encounter, Procedure, etc.
element.comment: The activity outcome is independent of the outcome of the related goal(s).  For example, if the goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lbs and an activity is defined to diet, then the activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas the goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.
element.requirements: Links plan to resulting actions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {Event that is outcome of Request in activity.reference}

element.short: Comentários sobre o status/progresso da atividade
element.definition: Comentários sobre o status/progresso da atividade
element.comment: This element should NOT be used to describe the activity to be performed - that occurs either within the resource pointed to by activity.detail.reference or in activity.detail.description.
element.requirements: Can be used to capture information about adherence, progress, concerns, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Detalhes da atividade definidos em recurso específico
element.definition: Detalhes da atividade definidos em recurso específico
element.comment: Standard extension exists ([resource-pertainsToGoal](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extension-resource-pertainstogoal.html)) that allows goals to be referenced from any of the referenced resources in CarePlan.activity.reference.  The goal should be visible when the resource referenced by CarePlan.activity.reference is viewed independently from the CarePlan.  Requests that are pointed to by a CarePlan using this element should *not* point to this CarePlan using the "basedOn" element.  i.e. Requests that are part of a CarePlan are not "based on" the CarePlan.
element.requirements: Details in a form consistent with other applications and contexts of use.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {Request that resulted in Event in activity.actionResulting}

element.short: Definição da atividade em conformidade
element.definition: Definição da atividade em conformidade
element.requirements: Details in a simple form for generic care plan systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Tipos de recursos definidos como parte do FHIR que podem ser representados como definições em conformidade de uma atividade do plano de cuidados
element.definition: Appointment | CommunicationRequest | DeviceRequest | MedicationRequest | NutritionOrder | Task | ServiceRequest | VisionPrescription
element.requirements: May determine what types of extensions are permitted.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Resource types defined as part of FHIR that can be represented as in-line definitions of a care plan activity.

element.short: Instancia o protocolo ou definição FHIR
element.definition: Instancia o protocolo ou definição FHIR
element.requirements: Allows Questionnaires that the patient (or practitioner) should fill in to fulfill the care plan activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Instancia protocolo externo ou definição
element.definition: Instancia protocolo externo ou definição
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.
element.requirements: Allows Questionnaires that the patient (or practitioner) should fill in to fulfill the care plan activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Tipo de atividade detalhada
element.definition: Tipo de atividade detalhada
element.comment: Tends to be less relevant for activities involving particular products.  Codes should not convey negation - use "prohibited" instead.
element.requirements: Allows matching performed to planned as well as validation against protocols.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Por que a atividade deve ser feita ou por que a atividade foi proibida
element.definition: Por que a atividade deve ser feita ou por que a atividade foi proibida
element.comment: This could be a diagnosis code.  If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonCondition instead.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies why a care plan activity is needed.  Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prophylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

element.short: Por que a atividade é necessária
element.definition: Por que a atividade é necessária
element.comment: Conditions can be identified at the activity level that are not identified as reasons for the overall plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Objetivos com os quais esta atividade se relaciona
element.definition: Objetivos com os quais esta atividade se relaciona
element.requirements: So that participants know the link explicitly.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Códigos que refletem o estado atual de uma atividade do plano de cuidados dentro de seu ciclo de vida geral.
element.definition: not-started | scheduled | in-progress | on-hold | completed | cancelled | stopped | unknown | entered-in-error
element.comment:
Some aspects of status can be inferred based on the resources linked in actionTaken.  Note that "status" is only as current as the plan was most recently updated.  
The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses.  The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the activity.
element.requirements: Indicates progress against the plan, whether the activity is still relevant for the plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the activity should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

mapping.map: .statusCode not-started = new scheduled = not-started (and fulfillment relationship to appointent) in-progress = active on-hold = suspended completed = completed cancelled = aborted

element.short: Motivo do status atual
element.definition: Motivo do status atual
element.comment: Will generally not be present if status is "complete".  Be sure to prompt to update this (or at least remove the existing value) if the status is changed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Se for verdade, a atividade está proibindo a ação
element.definition: Se for verdade, a atividade está proibindo a ação
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it marks an activity as an activity that is not to be performed.
element.requirements: Captures intention to not do something that may have been previously typical.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If missing indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: If true this element negates the specified action. For example, instead of a request for a procedure, it is a request for the procedure to not occur.

element.short: Quando a atividade deve ocorrer
element.definition: Quando a atividade deve ocorrer
element.requirements: Allows prompting for activities and detection of missed planned activities.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Onde a atividade deve ocorrer
element.definition: Onde a atividade deve ocorrer
element.comment: May reference a specific clinical location or may identify a type of location.
element.requirements: Helps in planning of activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quem será responsável pela atividade
element.definition: Quem será responsável pela atividade
element.comment: A performer MAY also be a participant in the care plan.
element.requirements: Helps in planning of activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (provider participations)); PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (non-provider person participations )) ; PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (patient non-subject of care) ) ; PRT-8

element.short: O que deve ser administrado/fornecido
element.definition: O que deve ser administrado/fornecido

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A product supplied or administered as part of a care plan activity.

element.short: Como consumir/dia?
element.definition: Como consumir/dia?
element.requirements: Allows rough dose checking.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quanto administrar/fornecer/consumir
element.definition: Quanto administrar/fornecer/consumir

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXO-11 / RXE-10 / RXD-4 / RXG-5 / RXA-6 /  TQ1-2.1  *and*  RXO-12 /  RXE-11 / RXD-5 / RXG-7 / RXA-7 / TQ1-2.2

element.short: Informações extras descrevendo a atividade a ser realizada
element.definition: Informações extras descrevendo a atividade a ser realizada

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Comentários sobre o plano de cuidados
element.definition: Comentários sobre o plano de cuidados
element.requirements: Used to capture information that applies to the plan as a whole that doesn't fit into discrete elements.
